intro: Echiochilon pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered echiochilon, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb native to southern Africa, typically found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided lobes that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
